content: I've tried cleaning the sensor and checking the battery level, but the issues persist. I think it's time for a new one. I'm interested in the Logitech M720 Triathlon, but I've heard that a clean computer environment can also affect the performance of wireless devices. Speaking of which, I recently cleaned my desktop computer and removed all the dust and dirt that had accumulated on the fans and vents, which seems to have improved its performance. Do you think a clean computer environment can also impact the performance of a wireless mouse?
